oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B & W photograph of Becker Homestead, Becker's Corners, Bethlehem, Albany County, NY. Home of La Grange A. Winne. Formerly home of Albertus Becker, grandson of an early settler. Dog in front. From Becker folder.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Elsmere Houses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B & W photograph of four houses at 248, 250, 252 and 254 Delaware Avenue, Elsmere, NY. Street not paved. Children on far right. Number 248 was owned by William A. Glenn, an Albany attorney, and his wife, Nettie.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Le Roy Nelson Letter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to William A. Glenn of Elsmere, NY from Le Roy Nelson, Electrical Contractor, Delmar, NY regarding an estimate to wire Glenn's house at 248 Delaware Avenue with electricity for $65.00. The house was owned by William A. Glenn, an Albany attorney, and his wife, Nettie. Letterhead stationary also includes the phrase, "H.R. Telephone."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nelson, Le Roy
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Contracts; Electricity
Nelson, Le Roy; Glenn, William A.; Glenn, Nettie.
Business & Industry
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Document ; 8.7 x 11 in. (22 x 28 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Prior written permission must be obtained for all uses.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slingerlands Sawmill/Cidermill
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B & W photograph of the sawmill/cidermill in Slingerlands, NY, located off Kenwood Avenue in the hollow across from Bridge Street. Bridge Street became a dead end when the bridge over the D & H Railroad was removed after the Cherry Avenue Extension was opened in September 1970. The business was owned by a member of the Coonley family, who lived on the southeast corner of Kenwood Avenue and Cherry Avenue. The mill was removed in the early 1940s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sawmills; Cider
